timeline.bodyText:
So we cannot use TestContainer like this, as the lifecycle is different from the Quarkus lifecycle.
You need to use a Quarkus Test Resource, and BTW, it will also let you set some properties dynamically.
Check how the Kafka quickstart is built as an example.
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: I will check how the Kafka quickstart is built.

timeline.bodyText:
This should be moved to a Quarkus Test Resources, and probably bound to a free port.
Also, I'm surprised about @ClassRule as it's a Junit 4 annotation.

replies.bodyText:
Okey I will move try to move this and try to bound to a free port.
